title: Chris Rock is hosting the Oscars
text:
Chris Rock is hosting the Oscars Chris Rock will host the 2016 Oscars, ABC announced Wednesday. This will be Rock's second time hosting the awards show, which he previously emceed in 2005. More >> Chris Rock will host the 2016 Oscars, ABC announced Wednesday. This will be Rock's second time hosting the awards show, which he previously emceed in 2005. More >> Petticoat Junction star Pat Woodell dies at 71 Pat Woodell, who played Bobbie Jo Bradley on the 1960s sitcom Petticoat Junction, died of cancer on Sept. 29 at her home in Fallbrook, Calif., The Associated Press reports. She was 71. More >> Pat Woodell, who played Bobbie Jo Bradley on the 1960s sitcom Petticoat Junction, died of cancer on Sept. 29 at her home in Fallbrook, Calif., The Associated Press reports. She was 71. More >> Khloe Kardashian has finally broken her silence about her estranged husband Lamar Odom's recent hospitalization. More >> Khloe Kardashian has finally broken her silence about her estranged husband Lamar Odom's recent hospitalization. More >> Tracy Morgan is continuing his comeback by launching a full-scale stand-up tour next year. More >> Tracy Morgan is continuing his comeback by launching a full-scale stand-up tour next year. More >> 
By Liz Raftery, 
Chris Rock will host the 2016 Oscars, ABC announced Wednesday. This will be Rock's second time hosting the awards show, which he previously emceed in 2005. 
"I'm so glad to be hosting the Oscars," the comedian said in a statement. "It's great to be back." 
Previously, producers David Hill and Reginald Hudlin had said there will be "at least two hosts" for the ceremony, which will take place on Sunday, Feb. 28. They have not indicated whether additional hosts will be named. "Chris Rock is truly the MVP of the entertainment industry," Hill and Hudlin said in a statement. "Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, documentarian - he's done it all. He's going to be a phenomenal Oscar host!" 
Prior to the announcement, some had speculated that the gig may go to Ricky Gervais , Amy Schumer , or Golden Globes hosts Amy Poehler and Tina Fey . 
Are you happy the Academy chose Rock to host?
